intro: Cephaelis alba, commonly known as the white flame of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered with fine hairs. Cephaelis alba is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated for its medicinal properties.
